title: Data Scientist
intro: Lead experimentation, modeling, and insights for AI-first products that serve thousands of users.
mission: Partner with product and engineering to design data products, improve model performance, and deploy experiments that directly shape customer experience.
responsibilities: Design, validate, and ship ML models for recommendations, scoring, and anomaly detection.
Own the experimentation loop: define hypotheses, design A/B tests, analyze results, and communicate findings.
Build clean data pipelines and features in collaboration with data engineering.
Instrument products to capture the right events and ensure data quality.
Translate complex findings into concise narratives for non-technical stakeholders.
requirements: 3+ years in data science or applied ML with shipped models in production.
Strong Python and SQL; experience with Pandas, scikit-learn, and at least one deep learning framework.
Comfort with experiment design, causal inference basics, and statistical rigor.
Experience deploying models as services or batch jobs (FastAPI, Airflow, etc.).
niceToHave: Experience with vector databases or RAG pipelines.
MLOps tooling (MLflow, Weights & Biases) and monitoring practices.

title: Product Designer
intro: Design end-to-end product experiences across web and mobile with a heavy emphasis on AI-assisted workflows.
mission: Translate strategy into clear flows, UI systems, and prototypes that engineers and stakeholders can ship with confidence.
responsibilities: Lead discovery, user interviews, and rapid prototyping for new features.
Create design systems, components, and specs that scale across products.
Collaborate with engineers to refine interactions and ensure high-quality delivery.
Measure shipped work with analytics and iterate based on insights.
Advocate for accessibility and inclusive design practices.
requirements: 3+ years designing digital products with a shipped portfolio.
Expertise in Figma plus familiarity with prototyping tools.
Ability to write clear UX copy and rationale for design decisions.
Comfort working closely with engineers in agile, iterative cycles.
niceToHave: Experience with AI/ML features or data-heavy interfaces.

title: WordPress Developer
intro: Build and optimize WordPress sites with modern tooling, performance discipline, and clean component patterns.
mission: Ship marketing and product sites that are fast, stable, and easy to maintain, working alongside design and content.
responsibilities: Develop custom themes/components with modern PHP and React-based tooling (Gutenberg/ACF).
Optimize performance, accessibility, and SEO fundamentals.
Integrate third-party APIs, forms, and analytics cleanly.
Maintain reusable blocks and documentation for content teams.
requirements: Solid understanding of WordPress, PHP, and modern frontend fundamentals.
Comfort with Git and collaborative workflows.
Basic knowledge of performance and accessibility best practices.

title: Technical Support Engineer
intro: Help customers succeed by diagnosing issues, improving support content, and keeping feedback loops tight with engineering.
mission: Troubleshoot production issues, create clear runbooks, and surface product insights that reduce future tickets.
responsibilities: Resolve Tier 1–2 tickets with clear, empathetic communication.
Reproduce, triage, and escalate bugs with actionable details and logs.
Write and maintain knowledge base articles and runbooks.
Collaborate with engineering on fixes and with product on UX improvements.
requirements: 2+ years in technical support or success roles for software products.
Strong debugging mindset with familiarity in browser dev tools and APIs.
Excellent written communication; comfortable with SLAs and prioritization.

title: Junior Graphic Designer
intro: Create visuals that support product launches, marketing campaigns, and brand storytelling across channels.
mission: Craft graphics, motion snippets, and presentation assets that keep our brand consistent and energetic.
responsibilities: Produce social, email, and landing page assets based on briefs and brand system.
Adapt complex ideas into simple, on-brand visuals.
Collaborate with marketing on timelines and asset handoff.
Maintain organized files, exports, and templates.
requirements: 1+ years of design experience or a strong portfolio of personal projects.
Proficiency in Figma and Adobe Suite.
Understanding of typography, layout, and color for digital mediums.

title: Digital Marketer (SEO Specialist)
intro: Own SEO strategy, content performance, and experimentation to grow organic traffic for our products.
mission: Plan roadmaps, optimize pages, and measure impact while partnering with content, design, and engineering.
responsibilities: Conduct keyword research, content briefs, and on-page optimization across web properties.
Implement technical SEO fixes with developers (schema, sitemaps, performance).
Design experiments to improve CTR, engagement, and conversions.
Report on rankings, traffic, and business KPIs with clear next steps.
requirements: 3+ years in SEO or growth marketing with measurable wins.
Experience with GA, GSC, Ahrefs/SEMrush, and A/B testing tools.
Ability to brief and review content for quality and intent alignment.
niceToHave: Understanding of CRO and landing page design.
